meanings.definition: The practice of transmuting base metals into gold.
meanings.sent1: In ancient tales, alchymies were believed to turn ordinary metals into precious gold.
meanings.sent2: The alchymies of old were said to possess the secret to transforming lead into gold.
meanings.sent3: The alchymies of the past were like modern-day alchemists trying to turn rocks into diamonds.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to turn simple ingredients into a gourmet meal was like performing alchymies in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The alchymies of nature can be seen in the changing colors of the leaves in autumn.

meanings.definition: A seemingly magical process of transformation, creation, or combination.
meanings.sent1: The growth of a seed into a towering tree is a natural alchymies we witness every day.
meanings.sent2: The artist's alchymies turned a blank canvas into a masterpiece of colors and shapes.
meanings.sent3: The alchymies of baking cookies always seem to involve a bit of magic and a lot of sugar.
meanings.sent4: The alchymies of friendship can turn strangers into lifelong companions.
meanings.sent5: The alchymies of storytelling can transport us to far-off lands and imaginary worlds.
